<title level="1" right="Focus 3" pfs="Standard">[Delay Affliction](/Spells.aspx?ID=751)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cursebound" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=320" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=319" />
<trait label="Positive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=128" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 231 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Mystery**
[Life](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=6)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

With a surge of healing energy, you push back against an affliction threatening the target and grant a small amount of healing. The target recovers 3d8 Hit Points. You attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) any one affliction you are aware the target has, suspending its effects for 1 hour on a success rather than removing it. The target is then temporarily immune to _delay affliction_ for 1 day. You don't need to have identified the name of the specific affliction, but you do need to be aware of it; for instance, you couldn't delay an [ingested](/Traits.aspx?ID=95) poison during its onset period unless you were aware of the poison.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The target recovers an additional 1d8 Hit Points and you can attempt to suspend an additional affliction.
name: Delay Affliction
